episodeTitle: I Will Surpass You! Rain Falls in Alabasta!
episodeTitleJapanese: 越えていく！アラバスタに雨が降る！
episodeTitleRomanized: Koete iku! Arabasuta ni ame ga furu!
description: Luffy and Crocodile's epic battle reaches its climax as Luffy unleashes his devastating Gomu Gomu no Storm attack, defeating the Warlord and sending him crashing through solid bedrock. With Crocodile's defeat, rain miraculously returns to Arabasta for the first time in three years, and Vivi's desperate pleas from the bell tower finally end the civil war.

events.title: Final Phase of Luffy vs Crocodile
events.description: The battle between Luffy and Crocodile intensifies in the underground tomb. Luffy continues his relentless assault on Crocodile, making significant headway and throwing him through the ancient ruins. Crocodile is confused as to why his scorpion venom isn't working on Luffy.
events.significance: This marks the beginning of the final phase of their third and decisive battle. Luffy has overcome Crocodile's poison, showing his incredible willpower and determination.

events.title: Crocodile's Hidden Knife
events.description: Crocodile deploys a concealed knife from the stub of his hook and lunges at Luffy in a desperate attack. Luffy counters by kicking him up into the ruins' rafters, showing his superior combat awareness.
events.significance: Demonstrates Crocodile's desperation and willingness to use any means necessary. Also showcases that Luffy has surpassed him in this battle.

events.title: Sables Pesado
events.description: Growing tired of the prolonged battle, Crocodile uses Sables Pesado, a powerful sand-based attack that creates a massive shockwave and blows away large portions of the ancient ruins.
events.significance: Shows Crocodile unleashing more of his devastating Devil Fruit abilities in an attempt to finish Luffy. The technique's destructive power demonstrates why he's a Warlord of the Sea.

events.title: Luffy Declares He Will Surpass Crocodile
events.description: When Crocodile asks if Luffy even knows who he's fighting, Luffy responds that he doesn't care and that he will surpass him. This declaration encapsulates Luffy's fearless spirit and unwavering determination to protect his friends and achieve his dreams.
events.significance: This is a defining character moment for Luffy, showing his growth and confidence. He's not intimidated by Crocodile's status as a Warlord - he's focused on surpassing any obstacle in his path to becoming Pirate King.

quotes.text: I don't care who you are! I will surpass you!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's declaration to Crocodile before their final clash

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Storm - First Use
events.description: Luffy debuts his devastating Gomu Gomu no Storm technique. He inflates his body using Gomu Gomu no Fusen, twists tightly, then blows air out while untwisting to rocket forward spinning, delivering a constant barrage of powerful punches similar to Gatling but with massively enhanced momentum.
events.significance: This is one of Luffy's most powerful pre-timeskip attacks and becomes one of his signature finishing moves. The technique demonstrates Luffy's creativity in combining multiple aspects of his Devil Fruit powers for devastating effect.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's first use of his devastating Storm technique

events.title: Desert La Spada
events.description: Crocodile counters with Desert La Spada, an altered version of Desert Spada where he forms several solid blades with fan-shaped edges made from compressed sand. This is the only time Crocodile creates solid objects from sand, showing the pinnacle of his Devil Fruit mastery.
events.significance: Represents Crocodile's ultimate defensive/offensive technique, demonstrating the full extent of his Suna Suna no Mi abilities. The fact that it still fails against Luffy's attack shows how thoroughly Luffy has overcome him.

events.title: Crocodile's Defeat - Punched Through Bedrock
events.description: Luffy's Gomu Gomu no Storm overpowers and breaks through Crocodile's Desert La Spada. The blood-soaked fists neutralize the sand blades, and Crocodile is pummeled against the ceiling. The force of the attack drives him through several feet of solid bedrock and launches him hundreds of feet into the air above Alubarna, creating a massive earthquake throughout the city.
events.significance: This is the climactic conclusion of the Arabasta Arc's main conflict. Crocodile's defeat represents Luffy's first victory over a Warlord of the Sea, proving the Straw Hat Pirates' strength and marking a major milestone in Luffy's journey. The sheer destructive power shown establishes a new level of combat capability.

events.title: Rain Returns to Arabasta
events.description: With Crocodile's defeat and loss of consciousness, the effect of his Suna Suna no Mi that had been preventing rainfall is neutralized. Rain falls on Arabasta for the first time in three years, ending the devastating drought that had plagued the kingdom.
events.significance: This miraculous moment marks the true liberation of Arabasta from Crocodile's manipulation. The return of rain symbolizes hope, renewal, and the end of the kingdom's suffering. It also reveals the extent of Crocodile's Devil Fruit influence over the environment.

quotes.speaker: Citizens
quotes.context: The people of Arabasta experiencing rain for the first time in three years

events.title: Vivi Stops the War
events.description: From atop the bell tower in Alubarna, Vivi continues her desperate pleas for the fighting to stop. As rain begins to fall, the warring factions - both the royal army and rebels - finally cease their battle. The people recognize their princess has survived and realize the truth about the conflict.
events.significance: This moment represents the culmination of Vivi's journey and her ultimate success in saving her kingdom without sacrificing lives. Her voice finally reaches her people, ending the civil war that threatened to destroy Arabasta.

quotes.speaker: Vivi
quotes.context: Vivi's desperate plea from the bell tower

events.title: The Civil War Ends
events.description: With the rain falling and Vivi's pleas finally heard, both the rebel army and the royal forces lay down their arms. The three-year conflict engineered by Crocodile comes to an end as the truth is revealed and the kingdom begins to heal.
events.significance: Marks the resolution of the Arabasta Arc's central conflict. The peaceful end to the war validates the Straw Hats' mission to help Vivi and represents triumph over Crocodile's elaborate conspiracy. This moment showcases the theme that understanding and truth can overcome manipulation and violence.

events.title: Straw Hats Witness the Rain
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates, who had been anxiously waiting for news of Luffy's battle, witness the miraculous rainfall. They initially rejoice at Luffy's victory, though they worry the civil war may continue despite Crocodile's defeat.
events.significance: Shows the crew's relief and their concern for the bigger picture beyond just defeating Crocodile. Highlights their investment in Vivi's cause and the kingdom's future.

quotes.text: I don't care who you are! I will surpass you!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's declaration to Crocodile before their final clash

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy unleashing his devastating new technique

quotes.speaker: Citizens of Arabasta
quotes.context: The people experiencing rain for the first time in three years

quotes.speaker: Vivi
quotes.context: Vivi's desperate plea from the bell tower that finally reaches her people

themes.description: Luffy's refusal to give up despite fighting a much more experienced opponent demonstrates the power of determination and willpower over raw strength and status.
themes.symbolism: Luffy's blood-soaked fists breaking through Crocodile's sand symbolize how determination can overcome seemingly insurmountable obstacles.

themes.description: The episode title and Luffy's declaration emphasize the importance of constantly pushing beyond perceived limitations to achieve one's dreams.
themes.symbolism: Luffy literally breaking through the ceiling represents breaking through the ceiling of expectations and limitations.

themes.description: The return of rain to Arabasta after three years of drought symbolizes hope, renewal, and the end of suffering brought by Crocodile's tyranny.
themes.symbolism: Rain represents cleansing, renewal, and the washing away of conflict and manipulation. It's a powerful symbol of rebirth for the kingdom.
culturalReferences: Rain as a symbol of blessing and renewal is common in many cultures, particularly relevant in desert settings

themes.theme: The Power of Voice and Communication
themes.description: Vivi's pleas finally being heard when combined with the miracle of rain shows how truth and honest communication can end conflicts.
themes.symbolism: The bell tower represents a platform for truth, elevating Vivi's voice above the chaos of war.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy proves he can defeat a Warlord of the Sea through sheer determination and creative use of his abilities. This victory marks a significant milestone in his journey, showing he's progressing toward his goal of becoming Pirate King.
keyActions: Declares he will surpass Crocodile regardless of his status
Debuts Gomu Gomu no Storm technique
Defeats Crocodile by punching him through solid bedrock
quotes: I don't care who you are! I will surpass you!

characterSpotlights.development: Crocodile's elaborate plan crumbles as he's defeated by a rookie pirate he underestimated. His loss represents not just a physical defeat but the complete failure of his years-long conspiracy.
keyActions: Unleashes Sables Pesado to destroy ruins
Defeated and launched through bedrock into the sky
Loss of consciousness ends the drought

characterSpotlights.development: Vivi achieves her goal of stopping the civil war through her unwavering determination and love for her people. Her voice finally reaches the citizens, proving the power of honest communication.
keyActions: Continues pleading from the bell tower
Proves her survival to her people

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the final clash between Luffy's Gomu Gomu no Storm and Crocodile's Desert La Spada with additional animation and impact frames not present in the manga.
The anime adds more reactions from the Straw Hat crew witnessing the rain and worrying about the civil war continuing.
The earthquake caused by Luffy's attack is depicted with more extensive destruction of buildings in the anime compared to the manga.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts portions of manga chapters 208, 209, and 210 from Volume 23.
The episode has an exceptional IMDb rating of 9.5, making it one of the highest-rated episodes of the Arabasta Arc.
Gomu Gomu no Storm, which debuts in this episode, becomes one of Luffy's most iconic finishing moves and is used repeatedly throughout the series.
The musical score during the final clash includes an excerpt from Dvořák's 'New World Symphony', adding dramatic weight to the moment.
There is a brief animation error where Crocodile's hook appears gold instead of its usual silver color.
This episode achieved a TV rating of 13.2% in Japan, ranking 5th for its time slot.
Desert La Spada is the only instance in the series where Crocodile creates solid objects from sand rather than loose sand formations.

The return of rain to Arabasta is explained as being caused by Crocodile's Devil Fruit influence being neutralized upon his defeat, though this raises questions about the mechanics of Devil Fruit environmental effects.
